Please RSVP!  (70 Memorial Drive, Cambridge, MA - Entrance at 2 Amherst Street.  Parking behind the building, or one block West off Amherst Street)

Trading Options by Randy Frederick

First, Randy will show how option Greeks reflect the pricing and movement of options.   He’ll explain how to use the Greeks to analyze and forecast options prices.   

Next, he’ll present several options strategies to hedge your portfolio and generate income.  These include covered calls, protective puts, collars, and cash secured puts.

Randy Frederick is Managing Director of Active Trading and Derivatives at the Schwab Center for Financial Research. He is one of the chief architects of Schwab’s option trading platforms and analytics tools. He focuses primarily on public relations, client education and market analysis. He has served on various corporate and industry committees including the FISD Executive Committee, the ISE allocation Committee and the ISE Board of Directors.

Frederick, a respected industry veteran with more than 20 years experience, writes blogs and educational articles for Schwab’s website and client newsletters. He hosted the weekly radio show “The Optional Hour” on TFNN from 2005 – 2007, and he has been published in trade magazines such as Active Trader, Futures & Options Trader, SFO and Futures. He is a frequent guest on CNBC and Bloomberg TV; he is a member of the Forbes Intelligent Investing team, and his comments appear regularly in the financial news media including The Wall Street Journal, Barron’s, the Financial Times, Bloomberg, Dow Jones, Reuters, USA Today, Forbes.com and TheStreet.com.   He authored the book The Traders Guide to Equity Spreads, which several BIG members recommend.

You can find parking behind the building, or one block West off Amherst Street.
